intro: Sisymbrium tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche mustard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branched stems. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Sisymbrium tehuelches is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and its potential use in traditional medicine.
